docs.text:
Class: ACLineSegment A wire or combination of wires, with consistent electrical characteristics, building a single electrical system, used to carry alternating current between points in the power system. For symmetrical, transposed three phase lines, it is sufficient to use attributes of the line segment, which describe impedances and admittances for the entire length of the segment. Additionally impedances can be computed by using length and associated per length impedances. The BaseVoltage at the two ends of ACLineSegments in a Line shall have the same BaseVoltage.nominalVoltage. However, boundary lines may have slightly different BaseVoltage.nominalVoltages and variation is allowed. Larger voltage difference in general requires use of an equivalent branch. docs.title: Class: ACLineSegment

docs.text: A wire or combination of wires, with consistent electrical characteristics, building a single electrical system, used to carry alternating current between points in the power system. For symmetrical, transposed three phase lines, it is sufficient to use attributes of the line segment, which describe impedances and admittances for the entire length of the segment. Additionally impedances can be computed by using length and associated per length impedances. The BaseVoltage at the two ends of ACLineSegments in a Line shall have the same BaseVoltage.nominalVoltage. However, boundary lines may have slightly different BaseVoltage.nominalVoltages and variation is allowed. Larger voltage difference in general requires use of an equivalent branch. The attribute is not used for EquivalentBranch,\ \ EquivalentShunt and EquivalentInjection." from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-nbl-forecast/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:Equipment.aggregate alias : aggregate owner : ACLineSegment domain_of : - Equipment range : boolean required : false multivalued : false normallyInService : name : normallyInService description : Specifies the availability of the equipment under normal operating conditions. True means the equipment is available for topology processing, which determines if the equipment is energized or not. False means that the equipment is treated by network applications as if it is not in the model. from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-nbl-forecast/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:Equipment.normallyInService alias : normallyInService owner : ACLineSegment domain_of : - Equipment range : boolean required : false multivalued : false EquipmentContainer : name : EquipmentContainer description : Container of this equipment. from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-nbl-forecast/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:Equipment.EquipmentContainer alias : EquipmentContainer owner : ACLineSegment domain_of : - Equipment range : EquipmentContainer required : false multivalued : false OperationalLimitSet : name : OperationalLimitSet description : The operational limit sets associated with this equipment. from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-nbl-forecast/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:Equipment.OperationalLimitSet alias : OperationalLimitSet owner : ACLineSegment domain_of : - Equipment - OperationalLimit range : OperationalLimitSet required : false multivalued : true alias_name : name : alias_name description : "The aliasName is free text human readable name of the object alternative\ \ to IdentifiedObject.name. For example, this specifies if the measurement represents an indoor temperature, outdoor temperature, bus voltage, line flow, etc. When the measurementType is set to "Specialization", the type of Measurement is defined in more detail by the specialized class which inherits from Measurement.' from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-nbl-forecast/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:Measurement.measurementType alias : measurementType owner : Analog domain_of : - Measurement range : string required : true multivalued : false phases : name : phases description : 'Indicates to which phases the measurement applies and avoids the need to use '' measurementType '' to also encode phase information (which would explode the types). The phase information in Measurement, along with '' measurementType '' and '' phases '' uniquely defines a Measurement for a device, based on normal network phase. Their meaning will not change when the computed energizing phasing is changed due to jumpers or other reasons. If the attribute is missing three phases (ABC) shall be assumed.' from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-nbl-forecast/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:Measurement.phases alias : phases owner : Analog domain_of : - Measurement range : PhaseCode required : false multivalued : false unitMultiplier : name : unitMultiplier description : The unit multiplier of the measured quantity. from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-nbl-forecast/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:Measurement.unitMultiplier alias : unitMultiplier owner : Analog domain_of : - Measurement range : UnitMultiplier required : true multivalued : false unitSymbol : name : unitSymbol description : The unit of measure of the measured quantity. from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-nbl-forecast/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:Measurement.unitSymbol alias : unitSymbol owner : Analog domain_of : - Measurement range : UnitSymbol required : true multivalued : false alias_name : name : alias_name description : "The aliasName is free text human readable name of the object alternative\ \ to IdentifiedObject.name. It is applicable in cases when the dedicated\ \ classes for equivalent equipment do not have all of the attributes necessary\ \ to represent the required level of detail. In case the flag is set to “true”\ \ the single instance of equipment represents multiple pieces of equipment that\ \ have been modelled together as an aggregate equivalent obtained by a network\ \ reduction procedure. Examples would be power transformers or synchronous machines\ \ operating in parallel modelled as a single aggregate power transformer or\ \ aggregate synchronous machine. 
The attribute is not used for EquivalentBranch,\ \ EquivalentShunt and EquivalentInjection." from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-nbl-forecast/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:Equipment.aggregate alias : aggregate owner : ConductingEquipment domain_of : - Equipment range : boolean required : false multivalued : false normallyInService : name : normallyInService description : Specifies the availability of the equipment under normal operating conditions. True means the equipment is available for topology processing, which determines if the equipment is energized or not. False means that the equipment is treated by network applications as if it is not in the model. from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-nbl-forecast/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:Equipment.normallyInService alias : normallyInService owner : ConductingEquipment domain_of : - Equipment range : boolean required : false multivalued : false EquipmentContainer : name : EquipmentContainer description : Container of this equipment. from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-nbl-forecast/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:Equipment.EquipmentContainer alias : EquipmentContainer owner : ConductingEquipment domain_of : - Equipment range : EquipmentContainer required : false multivalued : false OperationalLimitSet : name : OperationalLimitSet description : The operational limit sets associated with this equipment. from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-nbl-forecast/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:Equipment.OperationalLimitSet alias : OperationalLimitSet owner : ConductingEquipment domain_of : - Equipment - OperationalLimit range : OperationalLimitSet required : false multivalued : true alias_name : name : alias_name description : "The aliasName is free text human readable name of the object alternative\ \ to IdentifiedObject.name. name : ConductingEquipment description : The parts of the AC power system that are designed to carry current or that are conductively connected through terminals. from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-nbl-forecast/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 is_a : Equipment attributes : aggregate : name : aggregate description : "The aggregate flag provides an alternative way of representing an\ \ aggregated (equivalent) element. It is applicable in cases when the dedicated\ \ classes for equivalent equipment do not have all of the attributes necessary\ \ to represent the required level of detail. In case the flag is set to “true”\ \ the single instance of equipment represents multiple pieces of equipment that\ \ have been modelled together as an aggregate equivalent obtained by a network\ \ reduction procedure. Examples would be power transformers or synchronous machines\ \ operating in parallel modelled as a single aggregate power transformer or\ \ aggregate synchronous machine. 
The attribute is not used for EquivalentBranch,\ \ EquivalentShunt and EquivalentInjection." from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-nbl-forecast/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:Equipment.aggregate alias : aggregate owner : ConductingEquipment domain_of : - Equipment range : boolean required : false multivalued : false normallyInService : name : normallyInService description : Specifies the availability of the equipment under normal operating conditions. docs.text: name : Conductor description : Combination of conducting material with consistent electrical characteristics, building a single electrical system, used to carry current between points in the power system. from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-nbl-forecast/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 is_a : ConductingEquipment class_uri : cim:Conductor

docs.text:
name : Conductor description : Combination of conducting material with consistent electrical characteristics, building a single electrical system, used to carry current between points in the power system. from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-nbl-forecast/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 is_a : ConductingEquipment attributes : aggregate : name : aggregate description : "The aggregate flag provides an alternative way of representing an\ \ aggregated (equivalent) element. It is applicable in cases when the dedicated\ \ classes for equivalent equipment do not have all of the attributes necessary\ \ to represent the required level of detail. In case the flag is set to “true”\ \ the single instance of equipment represents multiple pieces of equipment that\ \ have been modelled together as an aggregate equivalent obtained by a network\ \ reduction procedure. Examples would be power transformers or synchronous machines\ \ operating in parallel modelled as a single aggregate power transformer or\ \ aggregate synchronous machine. 
The attribute is not used for EquivalentBranch,\ \ EquivalentShunt and EquivalentInjection." from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-nbl-forecast/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:Equipment.aggregate alias : aggregate owner : Conductor domain_of : - Equipment range : boolean required : false multivalued : false normallyInService : name : normallyInService description : Specifies the availability of the equipment under normal operating conditions. True means the equipment is available for topology processing, which determines if the equipment is energized or not. False means that the equipment is treated by network applications as if it is not in the model. from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-nbl-forecast/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:Equipment.normallyInService alias : normallyInService owner : Conductor domain_of : - Equipment range : boolean required : false multivalued : false EquipmentContainer : name : EquipmentContainer description : Container of this equipment. from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-nbl-forecast/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:Equipment.EquipmentContainer alias : EquipmentContainer owner : Conductor domain_of : - Equipment range : EquipmentContainer required : false multivalued : false OperationalLimitSet : name : OperationalLimitSet description : The operational limit sets associated with this equipment. from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-nbl-forecast/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:Equipment.OperationalLimitSet alias : OperationalLimitSet owner : Conductor domain_of : - Equipment - OperationalLimit range : OperationalLimitSet required : false multivalued : true alias_name : name : alias_name description : "The aliasName is free text human readable name of the object alternative\ \ to IdentifiedObject.name. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a\ \ naming hierarchy.
The attribute aliasName is retained because of backwards\ \ compatibility between CIM relases. It is however recommended to replace aliasName\ \ with the Name class as aliasName is planned for retirement at a future time.\ 

" from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-nbl-forecast/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:IdentifiedObject.aliasName alias : alias_name owner : Conductor domain_of : - IdentifiedObject range : string required : false multivalued : false description : name : description description : The description is a free human readable text describing or naming the object. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy. from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-nbl-forecast/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:IdentifiedObject.description alias : description owner : Conductor domain_of : - IdentifiedObject - NameType - NameTypeAuthority range : string required : false multivalued : false energy_ident_code_eic : name : energy_ident_code_eic description : The attribute is used for an exchange of the EIC code (Energy identification Code). The length of the string is 16 characters as defined by the EIC code. For details on EIC scheme please refer to ENTSO-E web site. from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-nbl-forecast/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : eu:IdentifiedObject.energyIdentCodeEic alias : energy_ident_code_eic owner : Conductor domain_of : - IdentifiedObject range : string required : false multivalued : false european_article_number_ean : name : european_article_number_ean description : The attribute is used for an exchange of the EAN code (European Article Number). The length of the string is 16 characters as defined by the EAN code. For details on EAN scheme please refer to the [Codebesluit toekenning EAN-codes elektriciteit](https://www.acm.nl/nl/publicaties/codebesluit-toekenning-ean-codes-elektriciteit). from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-nbl-forecast/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : nl:IdentifiedObject.europeanArticleNumberEAN alias : european_article_number_ean owner : Conductor domain_of : - IdentifiedObject range : string required : false multivalued : false m_rid : name : m_rid description : "Master resource identifier issued by a model authority. The mRID\ \ is unique within an exchange context. Global uniqueness is easily achieved\ \ by using a UUID, as specified in RFC 4122, for the mRID. The use of UUID is\ \ strongly recommended.
For CIMXML data files in RDF syntax conforming to\ \ IEC 61970-552, the mRID is mapped to rdf:ID or rdf:about attributes that identify\ \ CIM object elements." from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-nbl-forecast/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:IdentifiedObject.mRID alias : m_rid owner : Conductor domain_of : - IdentifiedObject range : string required : false multivalued : false names : name : names description : All names of this identified object. from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-nbl-forecast/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:IdentifiedObject.Names alias : names owner : Conductor domain_of : - IdentifiedObject - NameType range : Name required : false multivalued : true aliasName : name : aliasName description : "The aliasName is free text human readable name of the object alternative\ \ to IdentifiedObject.name. The attribute aliasName is retained because of backwards\ \ compatibility between CIM relases. It is however recommended to replace aliasName\ \ with the Name class as aliasName is planned for retirement at a future time.\ 

" from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-nbl-forecast/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:IdentifiedObject.aliasName alias : aliasName owner : Conductor domain_of : - IdentifiedObject range : string required : false multivalued : false mRID : name : mRID description : "Master resource identifier issued by a model authority. For CIMXML data files in RDF syntax conforming to\ \ IEC 61970-552, the mRID is mapped to rdf:ID or rdf:about attributes that identify\ \ CIM object elements." from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-nbl-forecast/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:IdentifiedObject.mRID alias : mRID owner : Conductor domain_of : - IdentifiedObject range : string required : false multivalued : false energyIdentCodeEic : name : energyIdentCodeEic description : The attribute is used for an exchange of the EIC code (Energy identification Code). It is applicable in cases when the dedicated\ \ classes for equivalent equipment do not have all of the attributes necessary\ \ to represent the required level of detail. In case the flag is set to “true”\ \ the single instance of equipment represents multiple pieces of equipment that\ \ have been modelled together as an aggregate equivalent obtained by a network\ \ reduction procedure. Examples would be power transformers or synchronous machines\ \ operating in parallel modelled as a single aggregate power transformer or\ \ aggregate synchronous machine.

docs.text: Generic user of energy - a point of consumption on the power system model. EnergyConsumer.pfixed, .qfixed, .pfixedPct and .qfixedPct have meaning only if there is no LoadResponseCharacteristic associated with EnergyConsumer or if LoadResponseCharacteristic.exponentModel is set to False. name : EnergyConsumer description : 'Generic user of energy - a point of consumption on the power system model. It is applicable in cases when the dedicated\ \ classes for equivalent equipment do not have all of the attributes necessary\ \ to represent the required level of detail. In case the flag is set to “true”\ \ the single instance of equipment represents multiple pieces of equipment that\ \ have been modelled together as an aggregate equivalent obtained by a network\ \ reduction procedure. Examples would be power transformers or synchronous machines\ \ operating in parallel modelled as a single aggregate power transformer or\ \ aggregate synchronous machine. 
The attribute is not used for EquivalentBranch,\ \ EquivalentShunt and EquivalentInjection." from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-nbl-forecast/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:Equipment.aggregate alias : aggregate owner : EnergyConsumer domain_of : - Equipment range : boolean required : false multivalued : false normallyInService : name : normallyInService description : Specifies the availability of the equipment under normal operating conditions. name : EnergySource description : A generic equivalent for an energy supplier on a transmission or distribution voltage level. from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-nbl-forecast/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 is_a : EnergyConnection attributes : aggregate : name : aggregate description : "The aggregate flag provides an alternative way of representing an\ \ aggregated (equivalent) element. It is applicable in cases when the dedicated\ \ classes for equivalent equipment do not have all of the attributes necessary\ \ to represent the required level of detail. In case the flag is set to “true”\ \ the single instance of equipment represents multiple pieces of equipment that\ \ have been modelled together as an aggregate equivalent obtained by a network\ \ reduction procedure. Examples would be power transformers or synchronous machines\ \ operating in parallel modelled as a single aggregate power transformer or\ \ aggregate synchronous machine. 
The attribute is not used for EquivalentBranch,\ \ EquivalentShunt and EquivalentInjection." from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-nbl-forecast/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:Equipment.aggregate alias : aggregate owner : EnergySource domain_of : - Equipment range : boolean required : false multivalued : false normallyInService : name : normallyInService description : Specifies the availability of the equipment under normal operating conditions. True means the equipment is available for topology processing, which determines if the equipment is energized or not. False means that the equipment is treated by network applications as if it is not in the model. from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-nbl-forecast/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:Equipment.normallyInService alias : normallyInService owner : EnergySource domain_of : - Equipment range : boolean required : false multivalued : false EquipmentContainer : name : EquipmentContainer description : Container of this equipment. from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-nbl-forecast/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:Equipment.EquipmentContainer alias : EquipmentContainer owner : EnergySource domain_of : - Equipment range : EquipmentContainer required : false multivalued : false OperationalLimitSet : name : OperationalLimitSet description : The operational limit sets associated with this equipment. from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-nbl-forecast/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:Equipment.OperationalLimitSet alias : OperationalLimitSet owner : EnergySource domain_of : - Equipment - OperationalLimit range : OperationalLimitSet required : false multivalued : true alias_name : name : alias_name description : "The aliasName is free text human readable name of the object alternative\ \ to IdentifiedObject.name. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a\ \ naming hierarchy.
The attribute aliasName is retained because of backwards\ \ compatibility between CIM relases. It is however recommended to replace aliasName\ \ with the Name class as aliasName is planned for retirement at a future time.\ 

" from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-nbl-forecast/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:IdentifiedObject.aliasName alias : alias_name owner : EnergySource domain_of : - IdentifiedObject range : string required : false multivalued : false description : name : description description : The description is a free human readable text describing or naming the object. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy. from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-nbl-forecast/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:IdentifiedObject.description alias : description owner : EnergySource domain_of : - IdentifiedObject - NameType - NameTypeAuthority range : string required : false multivalued : false energy_ident_code_eic : name : energy_ident_code_eic description : The attribute is used for an exchange of the EIC code (Energy identification Code). The length of the string is 16 characters as defined by the EIC code. For details on EIC scheme please refer to ENTSO-E web site. from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-nbl-forecast/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : eu:IdentifiedObject.energyIdentCodeEic alias : energy_ident_code_eic owner : EnergySource domain_of : - IdentifiedObject range : string required : false multivalued : false european_article_number_ean : name : european_article_number_ean description : The attribute is used for an exchange of the EAN code (European Article Number). The length of the string is 16 characters as defined by the EAN code. For details on EAN scheme please refer to the [Codebesluit toekenning EAN-codes elektriciteit](https://www.acm.nl/nl/publicaties/codebesluit-toekenning-ean-codes-elektriciteit). from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-nbl-forecast/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : nl:IdentifiedObject.europeanArticleNumberEAN alias : european_article_number_ean owner : EnergySource domain_of : - IdentifiedObject range : string required : false multivalued : false m_rid : name : m_rid description : "Master resource identifier issued by a model authority. The mRID\ \ is unique within an exchange context. Global uniqueness is easily achieved\ \ by using a UUID, as specified in RFC 4122, for the mRID. The use of UUID is\ \ strongly recommended.
For CIMXML data files in RDF syntax conforming to\ \ IEC 61970-552, the mRID is mapped to rdf:ID or rdf:about attributes that identify\ \ CIM object elements." from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-nbl-forecast/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:IdentifiedObject.mRID alias : m_rid owner : EnergySource domain_of : - IdentifiedObject range : string required : false multivalued : false names : name : names description : All names of this identified object. from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-nbl-forecast/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:IdentifiedObject.Names alias : names owner : EnergySource domain_of : - IdentifiedObject - NameType range : Name required : false multivalued : true aliasName : name : aliasName description : "The aliasName is free text human readable name of the object alternative\ \ to IdentifiedObject.name. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a\ \ naming hierarchy.
The attribute aliasName is retained because of backwards\ \ compatibility between CIM relases. It is however recommended to replace aliasName\ \ with the Name class as aliasName is planned for retirement at a future time.\ 

" from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-nbl-forecast/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:IdentifiedObject.aliasName alias : aliasName owner : EnergySource domain_of : - IdentifiedObject range : string required : false multivalued : false mRID : name : mRID description : "Master resource identifier issued by a model authority. For CIMXML data files in RDF syntax conforming to\ \ IEC 61970-552, the mRID is mapped to rdf:ID or rdf:about attributes that identify\ \ CIM object elements." from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-nbl-forecast/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:IdentifiedObject.mRID alias : mRID owner : EnergySource domain_of : - IdentifiedObject range : string required : false multivalued : false energyIdentCodeEic : name : energyIdentCodeEic description : The attribute is used for an exchange of the EIC code (Energy identification Code). The length of the string is 16 characters as defined by the EIC code. For details on EIC scheme please refer to ENTSO-E web site. from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-nbl-forecast/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : eu:IdentifiedObject.energyIdentCodeEic alias : energyIdentCodeEic owner : EnergySource domain_of : - IdentifiedObject range : string required : false multivalued : false shortName : name : shortName description : The attribute is used for an exchange of a human readable short name with length of the string 12 characters maximum. from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-nbl-forecast/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : eu:IdentifiedObject.shortName alias : shortName owner : EnergySource domain_of : - IdentifiedObject range : string required : false multivalued : false class_uri : cim:EnergySource

name : MarketEvaluationPoint description : The identification of an entity where energy products are measured or computed. from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-nbl-forecast/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 is_a : UsagePoint attributes : amiBillingReady : name : amiBillingReady description : "Tracks the lifecycle of the metering installation at a usage point\ \ with respect to readiness for billing via advanced metering infrastructure\ \ reads.
" from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-nbl-forecast/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:UsagePoint.amiBillingReady alias : amiBillingReady owner : MarketEvaluationPoint domain_of : - UsagePoint range : AmiBillingReadyKind required : false multivalued : false checkBilling : name : checkBilling description : True if as a result of an inspection or otherwise, there is a reason to suspect that a previous billing may have been performed with erroneous data. Value should be reset once this potential discrepancy has been resolved. from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-nbl-forecast/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:UsagePoint.checkBilling alias : checkBilling owner : MarketEvaluationPoint domain_of : - UsagePoint range : boolean required : false multivalued : false connectionCategory : name : connectionCategory description : A code used to specify the connection category, e.g., low voltage or low pressure, where the usage point is defined. from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-nbl-forecast/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:UsagePoint.connectionCategory alias : connectionCategory owner : MarketEvaluationPoint domain_of : - UsagePoint range : string required : false multivalued : false connectionState : name : connectionState description : "State of the usage point with respect to connection to the network.\ 
" from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-nbl-forecast/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:UsagePoint.connectionState alias : connectionState owner : MarketEvaluationPoint domain_of : - UsagePoint range : UsagePointConnectedKind required : false multivalued : false disconnectionMethod : name : disconnectionMethod description : Is an indication of how the usage point is physically connected or disconnected. from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-nbl-forecast/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:UsagePoint.disconnectionMethod alias : disconnectionMethod owner : MarketEvaluationPoint domain_of : - UsagePoint range : string required : false multivalued : false grounded : name : grounded description : True if grounded. from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-nbl-forecast/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:UsagePoint.grounded alias : grounded owner : MarketEvaluationPoint domain_of : - UsagePoint range : boolean required : false multivalued : false isSdp : name : isSdp description : "If true, this usage point is a service delivery point, i.e., a usage\ \ point where the ownership of the service changes hands.
" from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-nbl-forecast/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:UsagePoint.isSdp alias : isSdp owner : MarketEvaluationPoint domain_of : - UsagePoint range : boolean required : false multivalued : false isVirtual : name : isVirtual description : If true, this usage point is virtual, i.e., no physical location exists in the network where a meter could be located to collect the meter readings. For example, one may define a virtual usage point to serve as an aggregation of usage for all of a company's premises distributed widely across the distribution territory. Otherwise, the usage point is physical, i.e., there is a logical point in the network where a meter could be located to collect meter readings. from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-nbl-forecast/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:UsagePoint.isVirtual alias : isVirtual owner : MarketEvaluationPoint domain_of : - UsagePoint range : boolean required : false multivalued : false minimalUsageExpected : name : minimalUsageExpected description : If true, minimal or zero usage is expected at this usage point for situations such as premises vacancy, logical or physical disconnect. It is used for readings validation and estimation. from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-nbl-forecast/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:UsagePoint.minimalUsageExpected alias : minimalUsageExpected owner : MarketEvaluationPoint domain_of : - UsagePoint range : boolean required : false multivalued : false outageRegion : name : outageRegion description : "Outage region in which this usage point is located.
" from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-nbl-forecast/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:UsagePoint.outageRegion alias : outageRegion owner : MarketEvaluationPoint domain_of : - UsagePoint range : string required : false multivalued : false phaseCode : name : phaseCode description : "Phase code. Number of wires and specific nominal phases can be deduced\ \ from enumeration literal values. For example, ABCN is three-phase, four-wire,\ \ s12n (splitSecondary12N) is single-phase, three-wire, and s1n and s2n are\ \ single-phase, two-wire.
" from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-nbl-forecast/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:UsagePoint.phaseCode alias : phaseCode owner : MarketEvaluationPoint domain_of : - UsagePoint range : PhaseCode required : false multivalued : false phaseCount : name : phaseCount description : "Number of potential phases the Usage Point supports, typically 0,\ \ 1 or 3.
" from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-nbl-forecast/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:UsagePoint.phaseCount alias : phaseCount owner : MarketEvaluationPoint domain_of : - UsagePoint range : integer required : false multivalued : false readCycle : name : readCycle description : "Cycle day on which the meter for this usage point will normally\ \ be read. Usually correlated with the billing cycle.
" from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-nbl-forecast/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:UsagePoint.readCycle alias : readCycle owner : MarketEvaluationPoint domain_of : - UsagePoint range : string required : false multivalued : false readRoute : name : readRoute description : "Identifier of the route to which this usage point is assigned for\ \ purposes of meter reading. Typically used to configure hand held meter reading\ \ systems prior to collection of reads.
" from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-nbl-forecast/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:UsagePoint.readRoute alias : readRoute owner : MarketEvaluationPoint domain_of : - UsagePoint range : string required : false multivalued : false serviceDeliveryRemark : name : serviceDeliveryRemark description : "Remarks about this usage point, for example the reason for it being\ \ rated with a non-nominal priority.

Note that usage points\ \ at the same service location can have different priorities.
" from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-nbl-forecast/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:UsagePoint.servicePriority alias : servicePriority owner : MarketEvaluationPoint domain_of : - UsagePoint range : string required : false multivalued : false alias_name : name : alias_name description : "The aliasName is free text human readable name of the object alternative\ \ to IdentifiedObject.name. The attribute aliasName is retained because of backwards\ \ compatibility between CIM relases. It is however recommended to replace aliasName\ \ with the Name class as aliasName is planned for retirement at a future time.\

docs.text:
Class: Measurement _A Measurement represents any measured, calculated or non-measured non-calculated quantity. Any piece of equipment may contain Measurements, e.g. a substation may have temperature measurements and door open indications, a transformer may have oil temperature and tank pressure measurements, a bay may contain a number of power flow measurements and a Breaker may contain a switch status measurement. _ The PSR - Measurement association is intended to capture this use of Measurement and is included in the naming hierarchy based on EquipmentContainer. The naming hierarchy typically has Measurements as leaves, e.g. Substation-VoltageLevel-Bay-Switch-Measurement. _Some Measurements represent quantities related to a particular sensor location in the network, e.g. a voltage transformer (VT) or potential transformer (PT) at a busbar or a current transformer (CT) at the bar between a breaker and an isolator. The sensing position is not captured in the PSR - Measurement association. Instead it is captured by the Measurement - Terminal association that is used to define the sensing location in the network topology. The location is defined by the connection of the Terminal to ConductingEquipment. _ If both a Terminal and PSR are associated, and the PSR is of type ConductingEquipment, the associated Terminal should belong to that ConductingEquipment instance. When the sensor location is needed both Measurement-PSR and Measurement-Terminal are used. The Measurement-Terminal association is never used alone. Any piece of equipment may contain Measurements, e.g. a substation may\ \ have temperature measurements and door open indications, a transformer may have\ \ oil temperature and tank pressure measurements, a bay may contain a number of\ \ power flow measurements and a Breaker may contain a switch status measurement.\ \ 
The PSR - Measurement association is intended to capture this use of Measurement\ \ and is included in the naming hierarchy based on EquipmentContainer. The naming\ \ hierarchy typically has Measurements as leaves, e.g. Substation-VoltageLevel-Bay-Switch-Measurement.
\ Some Measurements represent quantities related to a particular sensor location in\ \ the network, e.g. a voltage transformer (VT) or potential transformer (PT) at\ \ a busbar or a current transformer (CT) at the bar between a breaker and an isolator.\ \ The sensing position is not captured in the PSR - Measurement association. Instead\ \ it is captured by the Measurement - Terminal association that is used to define\ \ the sensing location in the network topology. The location is defined by the connection\ \ of the Terminal to ConductingEquipment. 
If both a Terminal and PSR are associated,\ \ and the PSR is of type ConductingEquipment, the associated Terminal should belong\ \ to that ConductingEquipment instance.
When the sensor location is needed both\ \ Measurement-PSR and Measurement-Terminal are used. The Measurement-Terminal association\ \ is never used alone." from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-nbl-forecast/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 is_a : IdentifiedObject attributes : measurementType : name : measurementType description : 'Specifies the type of measurement. For example, this specifies if the measurement represents an indoor temperature, outdoor temperature, bus voltage, line flow, etc. When the measurementType is set to "Specialization", the type of Measurement is defined in more detail by the specialized class which inherits from Measurement.' from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-nbl-forecast/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:Measurement.measurementType domain_of : - Measurement range : string required : true multivalued : false phases : name : phases description : 'Indicates to which phases the measurement applies and avoids the need to use '' measurementType '' to also encode phase information (which would explode the types). Their meaning will not change when the computed energizing phasing is changed due to jumpers or other reasons. docs.title: Class: Measurement

docs.text: _A Measurement represents any measured, calculated or non-measured non-calculated quantity. Any piece of equipment may contain Measurements, e.g. a substation may have temperature measurements and door open indications, a transformer may have oil temperature and tank pressure measurements, a bay may contain a number of power flow measurements and a Breaker may contain a switch status measurement. _ The PSR - Measurement association is intended to capture this use of Measurement and is included in the naming hierarchy based on EquipmentContainer. The naming hierarchy typically has Measurements as leaves, e.g. Substation-VoltageLevel-Bay-Switch-Measurement. _Some Measurements represent quantities related to a particular sensor location in the network, e.g. a voltage transformer (VT) or potential transformer (PT) at a busbar or a current transformer (CT) at the bar between a breaker and an isolator. The sensing position is not captured in the PSR - Measurement association. Instead it is captured by the Measurement - Terminal association that is used to define the sensing location in the network topology. The location is defined by the connection of the Terminal to ConductingEquipment. _ If both a Terminal and PSR are associated, and the PSR is of type ConductingEquipment, the associated Terminal should belong to that ConductingEquipment instance. When the sensor location is needed both Measurement-PSR and Measurement-Terminal are used. The Measurement-Terminal association is never used alone. name : Measurement description : "A Measurement represents any measured, calculated or non-measured non-calculated\ \ quantity. Any piece of equipment may contain Measurements, e.g. a substation may\ \ have temperature measurements and door open indications, a transformer may have\ \ oil temperature and tank pressure measurements, a bay may contain a number of\ \ power flow measurements and a Breaker may contain a switch status measurement.\ \ 
The PSR - Measurement association is intended to capture this use of Measurement\ \ and is included in the naming hierarchy based on EquipmentContainer. The naming\ \ hierarchy typically has Measurements as leaves, e.g. Substation-VoltageLevel-Bay-Switch-Measurement.
\ Some Measurements represent quantities related to a particular sensor location in\ \ the network, e.g. a voltage transformer (VT) or potential transformer (PT) at\ \ a busbar or a current transformer (CT) at the bar between a breaker and an isolator.\ \ The sensing position is not captured in the PSR - Measurement association. Instead\ \ it is captured by the Measurement - Terminal association that is used to define\ \ the sensing location in the network topology. The location is defined by the connection\ \ of the Terminal to ConductingEquipment. 
If both a Terminal and PSR are associated,\ \ and the PSR is of type ConductingEquipment, the associated Terminal should belong\ \ to that ConductingEquipment instance.
When the sensor location is needed both\ \ Measurement-PSR and Measurement-Terminal are used. The Measurement-Terminal association\ \ is never used alone." from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-nbl-forecast/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 is_a : IdentifiedObject attributes : measurementType : name : measurementType description : 'Specifies the type of measurement. For example, this specifies if the measurement represents an indoor temperature, outdoor temperature, bus voltage, line flow, etc. When the measurementType is set to "Specialization", the type of Measurement is defined in more detail by the specialized class which inherits from Measurement.' from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-nbl-forecast/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:Measurement.measurementType domain_of : - Measurement range : string required : true multivalued : false phases : name : phases description : 'Indicates to which phases the measurement applies and avoids the need to use '' measurementType '' to also encode phase information (which would explode the types). The phase information in Measurement, along with '' measurementType '' and '' phases '' uniquely defines a Measurement for a device, based on normal network phase. Their meaning will not change when the computed energizing phasing is changed due to jumpers or other reasons. If the attribute is missing three phases (ABC) shall be assumed.' from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-nbl-forecast/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:Measurement.phases domain_of : - Measurement range : PhaseCode required : false multivalued : false unitMultiplier : name : unitMultiplier description : The unit multiplier of the measured quantity. from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-nbl-forecast/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:Measurement.unitMultiplier domain_of : - Measurement range : UnitMultiplier required : true multivalued : false unitSymbol : name : unitSymbol description : The unit of measure of the measured quantity. from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-nbl-forecast/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:Measurement.unitSymbol domain_of : - Measurement range : UnitSymbol required : true multivalued : false class_uri : cim:Measurement

docs.text:
Class: NameType _Type of name. Possible values for attribute 'name' are implementation dependent but standard profiles may specify types. An enterprise may have multiple IT systems each having its own local name for the same object, e.g. a planning system may have different names from an EMS. An object may also have different names within the same IT system, e.g. localName as defined in CIM version 14. The definition from CIM14 is: _ _The localName is a human readable name of the object. It is a free text name local to a node in a naming hierarchy similar to a file directory structure. A power system related naming hierarchy may be: Substation, VoltageLevel, Equipment etc. Children of the same parent in such a hierarchy have names that typically are unique among them. _ __ URI: cim:NameType classDiagram class NameType click NameType href "../NameType" NameType : description NameType : name_type_authority NameType --> "0..1" NameTypeAuthority : name_type_authority click NameTypeAuthority href "../NameTypeAuthority" NameType : names NameType --> "*" Name : names click Name href "../Name" Slots Name Cardinality and Range Description Inheritance description 0..1 String Description of the name type direct name_type_authority 0..1 NameTypeAuthority Authority responsible for managing names of this type direct names * Name All names of this type direct Usages used by used in type used Name name_type range NameType NameTypeAuthority name_types range NameType Identifier and Mapping Information Schema Source from schema: http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-nbl-forecast/version#1.0.0 Mappings Mapping Type Mapped Value self cim:NameType native this:NameType LinkML Source Direct name : NameType description : "Type of name. An object may also have different\ \ names within the same IT system, e.g. localName as defined in CIM version 14.\ \ The definition from CIM14 is:
The localName is a human readable name of the\ \ object. It is a free text name local to a node in a naming hierarchy similar to\ \ a file directory structure. A power system related naming hierarchy may be: Substation,\ \ VoltageLevel, Equipment etc. Children of the same parent in such a hierarchy have\ \ names that typically are unique among them.

docs.text: _Type of name. Possible values for attribute 'name' are implementation dependent but standard profiles may specify types. An enterprise may have multiple IT systems each having its own local name for the same object, e.g. a planning system may have different names from an EMS. An object may also have different names within the same IT system, e.g. localName as defined in CIM version 14. The definition from CIM14 is: _ _The localName is a human readable name of the object. It is a free text name local to a node in a naming hierarchy similar to a file directory structure. A power system related naming hierarchy may be: Substation, VoltageLevel, Equipment etc. Children of the same parent in such a hierarchy have names that typically are unique among them. _ __ URI: cim:NameType classDiagram class NameType click NameType href "../NameType" NameType : description NameType : name_type_authority NameType --> "0..1" NameTypeAuthority : name_type_authority click NameTypeAuthority href "../NameTypeAuthority" NameType : names NameType --> "*" Name : names click Name href "../Name"

Class: OperationalLimit _A value and normal value associated with a specific kind of limit. _ _The sub class value and normalValue attributes vary inversely to the associated OperationalLimitType.acceptableDuration (acceptableDuration for short). _ If a particular piece of equipment has multiple operational limits of the same kind (apparent power, current, etc.), the limit with the greatest acceptableDuration shall have the smallest limit value and the limit with the smallest acceptableDuration shall have the largest limit value. Note: A large current can only be allowed to flow through a piece of equipment for a short duration without causing damage, but a lesser current can be allowed to flow for a longer duration. If\ \ a particular piece of equipment has multiple operational limits of the same kind\ \ (apparent power, current, etc.), the limit with the greatest acceptableDuration\ \ shall have the smallest limit value and the limit with the smallest acceptableDuration\ \ shall have the largest limit value. Note: A large current can only be allowed\ \ to flow through a piece of equipment for a short duration without causing damage,\ \ but a lesser current can be allowed to flow for a longer duration." from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-nbl-forecast/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 is_a : IdentifiedObject attributes : OperationalLimitSet : name : OperationalLimitSet description : The limit set to which the limit values belong. from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-nbl-forecast/version#1.0.0 slot_uri : cim:OperationalLimit.OperationalLimitSet domain_of : - Equipment - OperationalLimit range : OperationalLimitSet required : true multivalued : false class_uri : cim:OperationalLimit Induced name : OperationalLimit description : "A value and normal value associated with a specific kind of limit.

docs.text: name : OperationalLimit description : "A value and normal value associated with a specific kind of limit. \n\ The sub class value and normalValue attributes vary inversely to the associated\ \ OperationalLimitType.acceptableDuration (acceptableDuration for short). \nIf\ \ a particular piece of equipment has multiple operational limits of the same kind\ \ (apparent power, current, etc.), the limit with the greatest acceptableDuration\ \ shall have the smallest limit value and the limit with the smallest acceptableDuration\ \ shall have the largest limit value. Note: A large current can only be allowed\ \ to flow through a piece of equipment for a short duration without causing damage,\ \ but a lesser current can be allowed to flow for a longer duration." from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-nbl-forecast/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 is_a : IdentifiedObject attributes : OperationalLimitSet : name : OperationalLimitSet description : The limit set to which the limit values belong. from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-nbl-forecast/version#1.0.0 slot_uri : cim:OperationalLimit.OperationalLimitSet domain_of : - Equipment - OperationalLimit range : OperationalLimitSet required : true multivalued : false class_uri : cim:OperationalLimit

docs.text:
name : OperationalLimit description : "A value and normal value associated with a specific kind of limit. 
\ The sub class value and normalValue attributes vary inversely to the associated\ \ OperationalLimitType.acceptableDuration (acceptableDuration for short). 
If\ \ a particular piece of equipment has multiple operational limits of the same kind\ \ (apparent power, current, etc.), the limit with the greatest acceptableDuration\ \ shall have the smallest limit value and the limit with the smallest acceptableDuration\ \ shall have the largest limit value. Note: A large current can only be allowed\ \ to flow through a piece of equipment for a short duration without causing damage,\ \ but a lesser current can be allowed to flow for a longer duration." from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-nbl-forecast/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 is_a : IdentifiedObject attributes : OperationalLimitSet : name : OperationalLimitSet description : The limit set to which the limit values belong. from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-nbl-forecast/version#1.0.0 slot_uri : cim:OperationalLimit.OperationalLimitSet alias : OperationalLimitSet owner : OperationalLimit domain_of : - Equipment - OperationalLimit range : OperationalLimitSet required : true multivalued : false alias_name : name : alias_name description : "The aliasName is free text human readable name of the object alternative\ \ to IdentifiedObject.name. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a\ \ naming hierarchy.
The attribute aliasName is retained because of backwards\ \ compatibility between CIM relases. It is however recommended to replace aliasName\ \ with the Name class as aliasName is planned for retirement at a future time.\ 

" from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-nbl-forecast/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:IdentifiedObject.aliasName alias : alias_name owner : OperationalLimit domain_of : - IdentifiedObject range : string required : false multivalued : false description : name : description description : The description is a free human readable text describing or naming the object. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy. from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-nbl-forecast/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:IdentifiedObject.description alias : description owner : OperationalLimit domain_of : - IdentifiedObject - NameType - NameTypeAuthority range : string required : false multivalued : false energy_ident_code_eic : name : energy_ident_code_eic description : The attribute is used for an exchange of the EIC code (Energy identification Code). The length of the string is 16 characters as defined by the EIC code. For details on EIC scheme please refer to ENTSO-E web site. from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-nbl-forecast/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : eu:IdentifiedObject.energyIdentCodeEic alias : energy_ident_code_eic owner : OperationalLimit domain_of : - IdentifiedObject range : string required : false multivalued : false european_article_number_ean : name : european_article_number_ean description : The attribute is used for an exchange of the EAN code (European Article Number). The length of the string is 16 characters as defined by the EAN code. For details on EAN scheme please refer to the [Codebesluit toekenning EAN-codes elektriciteit](https://www.acm.nl/nl/publicaties/codebesluit-toekenning-ean-codes-elektriciteit). from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-nbl-forecast/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : nl:IdentifiedObject.europeanArticleNumberEAN alias : european_article_number_ean owner : OperationalLimit domain_of : - IdentifiedObject range : string required : false multivalued : false m_rid : name : m_rid description : "Master resource identifier issued by a model authority. The mRID\ \ is unique within an exchange context. Global uniqueness is easily achieved\ \ by using a UUID, as specified in RFC 4122, for the mRID. The use of UUID is\ \ strongly recommended.
For CIMXML data files in RDF syntax conforming to\ \ IEC 61970-552, the mRID is mapped to rdf:ID or rdf:about attributes that identify\ \ CIM object elements." from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-nbl-forecast/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:IdentifiedObject.mRID alias : m_rid owner : OperationalLimit domain_of : - IdentifiedObject range : string required : false multivalued : false names : name : names description : All names of this identified object. from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-nbl-forecast/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:IdentifiedObject.Names alias : names owner : OperationalLimit domain_of : - IdentifiedObject - NameType range : Name required : false multivalued : true aliasName : name : aliasName description : "The aliasName is free text human readable name of the object alternative\ \ to IdentifiedObject.name. The attribute aliasName is retained because of backwards\ \ compatibility between CIM relases. It is however recommended to replace aliasName\ \ with the Name class as aliasName is planned for retirement at a future time.\ 

" from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-nbl-forecast/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:IdentifiedObject.aliasName alias : aliasName owner : OperationalLimit domain_of : - IdentifiedObject range : string required : false multivalued : false mRID : name : mRID description : "Master resource identifier issued by a model authority. For CIMXML data files in RDF syntax conforming to\ \ IEC 61970-552, the mRID is mapped to rdf:ID or rdf:about attributes that identify\ \ CIM object elements." from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-nbl-forecast/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:IdentifiedObject.mRID alias : mRID owner : OperationalLimit domain_of : - IdentifiedObject range : string required : false multivalued : false energyIdentCodeEic : name : energyIdentCodeEic description : The attribute is used for an exchange of the EIC code (Energy identification Code). docs.text: Enum: PhaseCode _An unordered enumeration of phase identifiers. Allows designation of phases for both transmission and distribution equipment, circuits and loads. The enumeration, by itself, does not describe how the phases are connected together or connected to ground. Ground is not explicitly denoted as a phase. _ _Residential and small commercial loads are often served from single-phase, or split-phase, secondary circuits. For the example of s12N, phases 1 and 2 refer to hot wires that are 180 degrees out of phase, while N refers to the neutral wire. Through single-phase transformer connections, these secondary circuits may be served from one or two of the primary phases A, B, and C. For three-phase loads, use the A, B, C phase codes instead of s12N. _ The integer values are from IEC 61968-9 to support revenue metering applications. docs.text:
Class: PowerTransformer An electrical device consisting of two or more coupled windings, with or without a magnetic core, for introducing mutual coupling between electric circuits. Transformers can be used to control voltage and phase shift (active power flow). A power transformer may be composed of separate transformer tanks that need not be identical. A power transformer can be modelled with or without tanks and is intended for use in both balanced and unbalanced representations. A power transformer typically has two terminals, but may have one (grounding), three or more terminals. The inherited association ConductingEquipment.BaseVoltage should not be used. The association from TransformerEnd to BaseVoltage should be used instead. Value should be reset once this potential discrepancy has been resolved. from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-nbl-forecast/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:UsagePoint.checkBilling domain_of : - UsagePoint range : boolean required : false multivalued : false connectionCategory : name : connectionCategory description : A code used to specify the connection category, e.g., low voltage or low pressure, where the usage point is defined. from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-nbl-forecast/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:UsagePoint.connectionCategory domain_of : - UsagePoint range : string required : false multivalued : false connectionState : name : connectionState description : "State of the usage point with respect to connection to the network.\ 
" from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-nbl-forecast/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:UsagePoint.connectionState domain_of : - UsagePoint range : UsagePointConnectedKind required : false multivalued : false disconnectionMethod : name : disconnectionMethod description : Is an indication of how the usage point is physically connected or disconnected. from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-nbl-forecast/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:UsagePoint.disconnectionMethod domain_of : - UsagePoint range : string required : false multivalued : false grounded : name : grounded description : True if grounded. from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-nbl-forecast/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:UsagePoint.grounded domain_of : - UsagePoint range : boolean required : false multivalued : false isSdp : name : isSdp description : "If true, this usage point is a service delivery point, i.e., a usage\ \ point where the ownership of the service changes hands.
" from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-nbl-forecast/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:UsagePoint.isSdp domain_of : - UsagePoint range : boolean required : false multivalued : false isVirtual : name : isVirtual description : If true, this usage point is virtual, i.e., no physical location exists in the network where a meter could be located to collect the meter readings. For example, one may define a virtual usage point to serve as an aggregation of usage for all of a company's premises distributed widely across the distribution territory. Otherwise, the usage point is physical, i.e., there is a logical point in the network where a meter could be located to collect meter readings. from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-nbl-forecast/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:UsagePoint.isVirtual domain_of : - UsagePoint range : boolean required : false multivalued : false minimalUsageExpected : name : minimalUsageExpected description : If true, minimal or zero usage is expected at this usage point for situations such as premises vacancy, logical or physical disconnect. docs.title: Class: UsagePoint

docs.text: Logical or physical point in the network to which readings or events may be attributed. Used at the place where a physical or virtual meter may be located; however, it is not required that a meter be present. name : UsagePoint description : Logical or physical point in the network to which readings or events may be attributed. Used at the place where a physical or virtual meter may be located; however, it is not required that a meter be present. from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-nbl-forecast/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 is_a : IdentifiedObject attributes : amiBillingReady : name : amiBillingReady description : "Tracks the lifecycle of the metering installation at a usage point\ \ with respect to readiness for billing via advanced metering infrastructure\ \ reads.
" from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-nbl-forecast/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:UsagePoint.amiBillingReady domain_of : - UsagePoint range : AmiBillingReadyKind required : false multivalued : false checkBilling : name : checkBilling description : True if as a result of an inspection or otherwise, there is a reason to suspect that a previous billing may have been performed with erroneous data. Value should be reset once this potential discrepancy has been resolved. from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-nbl-forecast/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:UsagePoint.checkBilling domain_of : - UsagePoint range : boolean required : false multivalued : false connectionCategory : name : connectionCategory description : A code used to specify the connection category, e.g., low voltage or low pressure, where the usage point is defined. from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-nbl-forecast/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:UsagePoint.connectionCategory domain_of : - UsagePoint range : string required : false multivalued : false connectionState : name : connectionState description : "State of the usage point with respect to connection to the network.\ 
" from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-nbl-forecast/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:UsagePoint.connectionState domain_of : - UsagePoint range : UsagePointConnectedKind required : false multivalued : false disconnectionMethod : name : disconnectionMethod description : Is an indication of how the usage point is physically connected or disconnected. from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-nbl-forecast/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:UsagePoint.disconnectionMethod domain_of : - UsagePoint range : string required : false multivalued : false grounded : name : grounded description : True if grounded. from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-nbl-forecast/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:UsagePoint.grounded domain_of : - UsagePoint range : boolean required : false multivalued : false isSdp : name : isSdp description : "If true, this usage point is a service delivery point, i.e., a usage\ \ point where the ownership of the service changes hands.
" from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-nbl-forecast/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:UsagePoint.isSdp domain_of : - UsagePoint range : boolean required : false multivalued : false isVirtual : name : isVirtual description : If true, this usage point is virtual, i.e., no physical location exists in the network where a meter could be located to collect the meter readings. For example, one may define a virtual usage point to serve as an aggregation of usage for all of a company's premises distributed widely across the distribution territory. Otherwise, the usage point is physical, i.e., there is a logical point in the network where a meter could be located to collect meter readings. from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-nbl-forecast/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:UsagePoint.isVirtual domain_of : - UsagePoint range : boolean required : false multivalued : false minimalUsageExpected : name : minimalUsageExpected description : If true, minimal or zero usage is expected at this usage point for situations such as premises vacancy, logical or physical disconnect. It is used for readings validation and estimation. from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-nbl-forecast/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:UsagePoint.minimalUsageExpected domain_of : - UsagePoint range : boolean required : false multivalued : false outageRegion : name : outageRegion description : "Outage region in which this usage point is located.
" from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-nbl-forecast/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:UsagePoint.outageRegion domain_of : - UsagePoint range : string required : false multivalued : false phaseCode : name : phaseCode description : "Phase code. Number of wires and specific nominal phases can be deduced\ \ from enumeration literal values. For example, ABCN is three-phase, four-wire,\ \ s12n (splitSecondary12N) is single-phase, three-wire, and s1n and s2n are\ \ single-phase, two-wire.
" from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-nbl-forecast/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:UsagePoint.phaseCode domain_of : - UsagePoint range : PhaseCode required : false multivalued : false phaseCount : name : phaseCount description : "Number of potential phases the Usage Point supports, typically 0,\ \ 1 or 3.
" from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-nbl-forecast/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:UsagePoint.phaseCount domain_of : - UsagePoint range : integer required : false multivalued : false readCycle : name : readCycle description : "Cycle day on which the meter for this usage point will normally\ \ be read. Usually correlated with the billing cycle.
" from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-nbl-forecast/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:UsagePoint.readCycle domain_of : - UsagePoint range : string required : false multivalued : false readRoute : name : readRoute description : "Identifier of the route to which this usage point is assigned for\ \ purposes of meter reading. Typically used to configure hand held meter reading\ \ systems prior to collection of reads.
" from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-nbl-forecast/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:UsagePoint.readRoute domain_of : - UsagePoint range : string required : false multivalued : false serviceDeliveryRemark : name : serviceDeliveryRemark description : "Remarks about this usage point, for example the reason for it being\ \ rated with a non-nominal priority.
" from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-nbl-forecast/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:UsagePoint.serviceDeliveryRemark domain_of : - UsagePoint range : string required : false multivalued : false servicePriority : name : servicePriority description : "Priority of service for this usage point. Note that usage points\ \ at the same service location can have different priorities.
" from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-nbl-forecast/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:UsagePoint.servicePriority domain_of : - UsagePoint range : string required : false multivalued : false class_uri : cim:UsagePoint

docs.text: Slot: aggregate _The aggregate flag provides an alternative way of representing an aggregated (equivalent) element. It is applicable in cases when the dedicated classes for equivalent equipment do not have all of the attributes necessary to represent the required level of detail. In case the flag is set to “true” the single instance of equipment represents multiple pieces of equipment that have been modelled together as an aggregate equivalent obtained by a network reduction procedure. Examples would be power transformers or synchronous machines operating in parallel modelled as a single aggregate power transformer or aggregate synchronous machine. _ The attribute is not used for EquivalentBranch, EquivalentShunt and EquivalentInjection. URI: cim:Equipment.aggregate Applicable Classes Name Description Modifies Slot ConductingEquipment The parts of the AC power system that are designed to carry current or that a... no ACLineSegment A wire or combination of wires, with consistent electrical characteristics, b... no EnergyConsumer Generic user of energy - a point of consumption on the power system model no EnergySource A generic equivalent for an energy supplier on a transmission or distribution... no Equipment The parts of a power system that are physical devices, electronic or mechanic... no Conductor Combination of conducting material with consistent electrical characteristics... no EnergyConnection A connection of energy generation or consumption on the power system model no PowerTransformer An electrical device consisting of two or more coupled windings, with or wit... no Properties Range: Boolean Identifier and Mapping Information Schema Source from schema: http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-nbl-forecast/version#1.0.0 Mappings Mapping Type Mapped Value self cim:Equipment.aggregate native this:aggregate LinkML Source name : aggregate description : "The aggregate flag provides an alternative way of representing an aggregated\ \ (equivalent) element. It is applicable in cases when the dedicated classes for\ \ equivalent equipment do not have all of the attributes necessary to represent\ \ the required level of detail. In case the flag is set to “true” the single instance\ \ of equipment represents multiple pieces of equipment that have been modelled together\ \ as an aggregate equivalent obtained by a network reduction procedure. Examples\ \ would be power transformers or synchronous machines operating in parallel modelled\ \ as a single aggregate power transformer or aggregate synchronous machine. \n\ The attribute is not used for EquivalentBranch, EquivalentShunt and EquivalentInjection." from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-nbl-forecast/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:Equipment.aggregate alias : aggregate owner : Equipment domain_of : - Equipment range : boolean required : false multivalued : false

docs.text: _The aggregate flag provides an alternative way of representing an aggregated (equivalent) element. It is applicable in cases when the dedicated classes for equivalent equipment do not have all of the attributes necessary to represent the required level of detail. In case the flag is set to “true” the single instance of equipment represents multiple pieces of equipment that have been modelled together as an aggregate equivalent obtained by a network reduction procedure. Examples would be power transformers or synchronous machines operating in parallel modelled as a single aggregate power transformer or aggregate synchronous machine. _ The attribute is not used for EquivalentBranch, EquivalentShunt and EquivalentInjection. docs.text: name : aggregate description : "The aggregate flag provides an alternative way of representing an aggregated\ \ (equivalent) element. It is applicable in cases when the dedicated classes for\ \ equivalent equipment do not have all of the attributes necessary to represent\ \ the required level of detail. In case the flag is set to “true” the single instance\ \ of equipment represents multiple pieces of equipment that have been modelled together\ \ as an aggregate equivalent obtained by a network reduction procedure. Examples\ \ would be power transformers or synchronous machines operating in parallel modelled\ \ as a single aggregate power transformer or aggregate synchronous machine. \n\ The attribute is not used for EquivalentBranch, EquivalentShunt and EquivalentInjection." from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-nbl-forecast/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:Equipment.aggregate alias : aggregate owner : Equipment domain_of : - Equipment range : boolean required : false multivalued : false
docs.title: LinkML Source

docs.text: Slot: isVirtual If true, this usage point is virtual, i.e., no physical location exists in the network where a meter could be located to collect the meter readings. For example, one may define a virtual usage point to serve as an aggregation of usage for all of a company's premises distributed widely across the distribution territory. Otherwise, the usage point is physical, i.e., there is a logical point in the network where a meter could be located to collect meter readings. docs.text: Slot: mRID _Master resource identifier issued by a model authority. The mRID is unique within an exchange context. Global uniqueness is easily achieved by using a UUID, as specified in RFC 4122, for the mRID. The use of UUID is strongly recommended. _ For CIMXML data files in RDF syntax conforming to IEC 61970-552, the mRID is mapped to rdf:ID or rdf:about attributes that identify CIM object elements. The mRID is\ \ unique within an exchange context. Global uniqueness is easily achieved by using\ \ a UUID, as specified in RFC 4122, for the mRID. docs.text: Slot: measurementType Specifies the type of measurement. For example, this specifies if the measurement represents an indoor temperature, outdoor temperature, bus voltage, line flow, etc. When the measurementType is set to "Specialization", the type of Measurement is defined in more detail by the specialized class which inherits from Measurement. docs.text: Slot: normallyInService Specifies the availability of the equipment under normal operating conditions. True means the equipment is available for topology processing, which determines if the equipment is energized or not. False means that the equipment is treated by network applications as if it is not in the model. docs.text: Slot: phases Indicates to which phases the measurement applies and avoids the need to use 'measurementType' to also encode phase information (which would explode the types). The phase information in Measurement, along with 'measurementType' and 'phases' uniquely defines a Measurement for a device, based on normal network phase. Their meaning will not change when the computed energizing phasing is changed due to jumpers or other reasons. If the attribute is missing three phases (ABC) shall be assumed. URI: cim:Measurement.phases Applicable Classes Name Description Modifies Slot Measurement A Measurement represents any measured, calculated or non-measured non-calcula... no Analog Analog represents an analog Measurement no Properties Range: PhaseCode Identifier and Mapping Information Schema Source from schema: http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-nbl-forecast/version#1.0.0 Mappings Mapping Type Mapped Value self cim:Measurement.phases native this:phases LinkML Source name : phases description : 'Indicates to which phases the measurement applies and avoids the need to use '' measurementType '' to also encode phase information (which would explode the types). The phase information in Measurement, along with '' measurementType '' and '' phases '' uniquely defines a Measurement for a device, based on normal network phase. Their meaning will not change when the computed energizing phasing is changed due to jumpers or other reasons. If the attribute is missing three phases (ABC) shall be assumed.' from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-nbl-forecast/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:Measurement.phases alias : phases owner : Measurement domain_of : - Measurement range : PhaseCode required : false multivalued : false
